description_long: Assessment of strategies for the minimisation, storage, collection, and disposal of waste during both construction and operational phases of the development. Promotion of the waste hierarchy (reduce, reuse, recycle).
sub_questions: What is the strategy for managing waste during the construction phase, including targets for diversion from landfill (Site Waste Management Plan)?
How will different waste streams be segregated on-site during construction for reuse or recycling?
What provisions are made for the storage and collection of operational waste (municipal solid waste, recyclables, food waste, bulky waste) from the completed development?
Are the operational waste storage facilities adequately sized, located, and designed for ease of use and collection vehicle access?
How does the proposal encourage waste reduction and recycling by future occupants/users?
Are there any proposals for on-site waste treatment or energy recovery (e.g., composting, anaerobic digestion - less common for general planning)?
Does the scheme comply with local authority requirements for waste collection?
typical_positive_impacts: High rates of construction waste diverted from landfill.
Adequate, well-designed, and accessible operational waste storage promoting recycling.
Compliance with local authority waste collection requirements.
Innovative approaches to waste reduction or reuse.
Clear strategy for managing different waste streams.
typical_negative_impacts: Low rates of construction waste recycling and high landfill rates.
Inadequate or poorly designed operational waste storage leading to amenity issues (visual, odour, pests).
Insufficient space for waste segregation and recycling.
Difficult access for waste collection vehicles.
Failure to comply with local authority waste collection standards.
common_mitigation_measures: Implementation of a comprehensive Site Waste Management Plan (SWMP) for construction.
Off-site prefabrication to reduce construction waste.
Careful design of communal waste storage areas with sufficient capacity and clear labelling for different streams.
Ensuring convenient access for users to recycling facilities.
Designing collection points to accommodate local authority vehicle specifications.
Providing information to future occupants on waste reduction and recycling services.
